verses.kjv: And at that time shall Michael stand up, the great prince which standeth for the children of thy people: and there shall be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation even to that same time: and at that time thy people shall be delivered, every one that shall be found written in the book.
verses.ct: At that time, Michael — the great prince who protects your people — will rise up. There will be a period of distress unlike anything that has occurred since nations first existed. But at that time, your people will be rescued — everyone whose name is recorded in the book.

verses.kjv: And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.
verses.ct: Many of those who lie dead in the ground will rise again — some to eternal life, and others to disgrace and eternal shame.

verses.kjv: And they that be wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament; and they that turn many to righteousness as the stars for ever and ever.
verses.ct: Those who are wise will shine like the brightness of the expanse, and those who lead many to righteousness will shine like the stars forever and ever.

verses.kjv: But thou, O Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, even to the time of the end: many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased.
verses.ct: But you, Daniel, keep these words secret and seal up the book until the time of the end. Many will search back and forth, and knowledge will grow.

verses.kjv: Then I Daniel looked, and, behold, there stood other two, the one on this side of the bank of the river, and the other on that side of the bank of the river.
verses.ct: Then I, Daniel, looked and saw 2 others standing there — one on each side of the river.

verses.kjv: And one said to the man clothed in linen, which was upon the waters of the river, How long shall it be to the end of these wonders?
verses.ct: One of them asked the man dressed in linen who was above the waters of the river, 'How long until these astonishing events come to an end?'

verses.kjv: And I heard the man clothed in linen, which was upon the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a time, times, and an half; and when he shall have accomplished to scatter the power of the holy people, all these things shall be finished.
verses.ct: I heard the man dressed in linen who was above the waters of the river raise both his right hand and his left hand toward heaven and swear by the One who lives forever that it would be a time, times, and half a time. When the shattering of the holy people's power is complete, all these things will be finished.

verses.kjv: And I heard, but I understood not: then said I, O my Lord, what shall be the end of these things?
verses.ct: I heard this, but I didn't understand it. So I asked, 'My lord, what will be the final outcome of all this?'

verses.kjv: And he said, Go thy way, Daniel: for the words are closed up and sealed till the time of the end.
verses.ct: He replied, 'Go on your way, Daniel, because these words are kept secret and sealed until the time of the end.'

verses.kjv: Many shall be purified, and made white, and tried; but the wicked shall do wickedly: and none of the wicked shall understand; but the wise shall understand.
verses.ct: 'Many will be purified, cleansed, and refined. But the wicked will continue acting wickedly. None of the wicked will understand, but those who are wise will understand.'

verses.kjv: And from the time that the daily sacrifice shall be taken away, and the abomination that maketh desolate set up, there shall be a thousand two hundred and ninety days.
verses.ct: 'From the time the daily sacrifice is abolished and the devastating abomination is set up, there will be 1,290 days.'

verses.kjv: Blessed is he that waiteth, and cometh to the thousand three hundred and five and thirty days.
verses.ct: 'How fortunate is the one who perseveres and reaches the 1,335 days.'

verses.kjv: But go thou thy way till the end be: for thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at the end of the days.
verses.ct: 'Now go on your way until the end comes. You will rest, and then you will rise to receive your reward at the end of the days.'
